description: Variation to Condition 1 (Approved Plans) and Condition 5 (Side Facing Dormer Window) of Planning Permission ref: 19/03227/HOU (Erection of front, rear and side two storey extensions and loft conversion with installation of 3no. rooflights to the side roofslope) dated 18/02/2020. Variation to front elevation fenestration and side roof and fenestration and that condition 5 be amended to allow for the window to be openable.
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin be commenced within 3 years from the date of the permission (ref: 19/03227/HOU) dated 18 February 2020.Reason: As required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

The approved development shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings/details:18148/10_Rev A - Proposed scheme plan ground floor 1:10018148/11_Rev A - Proposed scheme plan first floor 1:10018148/12_Rev A - Proposed scheme plan mezzanine floor 1:10018148/13_Rev A - Proposed scheme roof plan 1:10018148/14_Rev A - Proposed scheme elevations front NE & rear SW18148/15_Rev A - Proposed scheme elevations NW & SE18148/16_Rev A - Proposed scheme views (1)18148/17_Rev A - Proposed scheme views (2)18148/01 - Location plan and images - Previously Submitted18148/02 - Site plan and images - Previously Submitted18148/03 - Existing plan basement floor 1:100 - Previously Submitted18148/04 - Existing plan ground floor 1:100 - Previously Submitted18148/05 - Existing plan first floor 1:100 - Previously Submitted18148/06 - Existing plan mezzanine 1:100 - Previously Submitted18148/07 - Existing roof plan 1:100 - Previously Submitted18148/08 - Existing elevations front NE & rear SW - Previously Submitted 18148/09 - Existing elevations NW & SE - Previously SubmittedReason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

The facing materials to be used in the construction of the building shall be those specified on the application form and approved drawings or such other materials as have been approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced and shall thereafter be retained as such.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any Order revoking or reenacting this Order) no windows or other openings (other than those hereby approved) shall be formed in the flank walls of the extension hereby approved without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To protect the amenities and privacy of the occupiers of the adjoining residential properties in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments, including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Within 2 months of the date of this decision, the side-facing dormer window to the eastern roofslope shall be fitted with, and retained in, obscure glazing to a minimum of Level 3 on the standard scale. Any film used to achieve the requisite obscurity level shall be non-perishable and tamper-proof and shall be replaced immediately in the event that it ceases to result in obscurity to level 3. Reason: To protect the amenities and privacy of the occupiers of the adjoining residential properties in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The side-facing dormer window to the eastern roofslope shall be fitted, and retained in perpetuity, with restricting stays so that it is not openable beyond 85mm from the outer edge of the frame and not fully openable other than for cleaning and maintenance purposes (no more than 3 times per year, for no more than 30 minutes). Reason: To protect the amenities and privacy of the occupiers of the adjoining residential properties in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
